00017 =head1 NAME
00018 
00019 contextPolynomialFactors.pl - Allow only entry of polynomials, and
00020                               their products and powers
00021 
00022 =head1 DESCRIPTION
00023 
00024 Implements a context in which students can only enter products and
00025 powers of polynomials
00026 
00027 Select the context using:
00028 
00029     Context("PolynomialFactors");
00030 
00031 If you set the "singlePowers" flag, then only one monomial of each
00032 degree can be included in each factor polynomial:
00033 
00034     Context("PolynomialFactors")->flags->set(singlePowers=>1);
00035 
00036 If you set the "singleFactors" flag, then factors can not be repeated.
00037 For example,
00038 
00039     Context("PolynomialFactors")->flags->set(singleFactors=>1);
00040     Formula("(x+1)^2*(x+1)");
00041 
00042 will generate an error indicating that factors can appear only once.
00043 Note, however, that this only catches factors that appear exactly the
00044 same in both cases, so (x+1)*(1+x) would be allowed, as would
00045 -(x-1)*(1-x).  Note also that there is no check for whether the
00046 factors are irreducible, so (x^2-1)*(x+1)*(x-1) would be allowed.
00047 Also, there is no check for whether constants have been factored out,
00048 so 3*(x+1)*(3x+3) would be allowed.  This still needs more work to
00049 make it very useful.
00050 
00051 There are two additional flags that control whether division by a
00052 constant or raising to a power are allowed to be performed on a
00053 product or factors or only on a single factor at at time.  These are
00054 strictDivision and strictPowers.  By default, strictDivisions is 0, so
00055 (x*(x+1))/3 is allowed, while strictPowers is 1, so (x*(x+1))^3 is not
00056 (it must be written x^3*(x+1)^3).
00057 
00058 Finally, there is also a strict context that does not allow
00059 operations even within the coefficients.  Select it using:
00060 
00061     Context("PolynomialFactors-Strict");
00062 
00063 In addition to disallowing operations within the coefficients, this
00064 context does not reduce constant operations (since they are not
00065 allowed), and sets the singlePowers, singleFactors, strictDivision,
00066 and stricPowers flags automatically.  In addition, it disables all the
00067 functions, though they can be re-enabled, if needed.
00068 
00069 =cut
00070

00078 sub _contextPolynomialFactors_init {PolynomialFactors::Init()}

00082 package PolynomialFactors::BOP::add;
00083 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPolynomial::BOP::add);
00084 
00085 sub checkPolynomial {
00086   my $self = shift;
00087   my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00088   $self->Error("Addition is allowed only between monomials")
00089     if $r->{isPoly} || ($l->{isPoly} && $l->{isPoly} > 2);
00090   $self->checkPowers;
00091 }
00092

00095 package PolynomialFactors::BOP::subtract;
00096 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPolynomial::BOP::subtract);
00097 
00098 sub checkPolynomial {
00099   my $self = shift;
00100   my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00101   $self->Error("Subtraction is allowed only between monomials")
00102     if $r->{isPoly} || ($l->{isPoly} && $l->{isPoly} > 2);
00103   $self->checkPowers;
00104 }

00106 ##############################################
00107 
00108 package PolynomialFactors::BOP::multiply;
00109 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPolynomial::BOP::multiply);
00110 
00111 sub checkPolynomial {
00112   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00113   my $lOK = (LimitedPolynomial::isConstant($l) || $l->{isPower} ||
00114          $l->class eq 'Variable' || ($l->{isPoly} && $l->{isPoly} == 2));
00115   my $rOK = ($r->{isPower} || $r->class eq 'Variable');
00116   return $self->checkExponents if $lOK and $rOK;
00117   $self->Error("Coefficients must come before variables or factors")
00118     if LimitedPolynomial::isConstant($r) && ($l->{isPower} || $l->class eq 'Variable');
00119   if ($l->{isPoly} || $r->{isPoly}) {
00120     PolynomialFactors::markFactor($l);
00121     PolynomialFactors::markFactor($r);
00122     return $self->checkFactors($l,$r);
00123   }
00124   return 1;
00125 }
00126 
00127 sub checkFactors {
00128   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = @_;
00129   my $single = $self->context->flag("singleFactors");
00130   $self->{factors} = $l->{factors}; delete $l->{factors};
00131   foreach my $factor (keys %{$r->{factors}}) {
00132     if ($single && $self->{factors}{$factor}) {
00133       $self->Error("Each factor can appear only once (combine like factors)") unless $factor eq "0";
00134       $self->Error("Only one constant coefficient or negation is allowed (combine them)");
00135     }
00136     $self->{factors}{$factor} = 1;
00137   }
00138   delete $r->{factors};
00139   $self->{isPoly} = 4; # product of factors
00140   return 1;
00141 }
00142 
00143 sub checkStrict {
00144   my $self = shift;
00145   $self->Error("You can only use '%s' between coefficents and variables or between factors",$self->{bop});
00146 }

00148 ##############################################
00149 
00150 package PolynomialFactors::BOP::divide;
00151 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPolynomial::BOP::divide);
00152 
00153 sub checkPolynomial {
00154   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00155   $self->Error("In a polynomial, you can only divide by numbers")
00156     unless LimitedPolynomial::isConstant($r);
00157   if ($l->{isPoly} && $l->{isPoly} != 2) {
00158     $self->Error("You can only divide a single term or factor by a number")
00159       if $l->{isPoly} == 3 || ($self->context->flag("strictDivision") && $l->{isPoly} != 1);
00160     PolynomialFactors::markOpFactor($self,$l);
00161     $self->Error("Only one constant multiple or fraction is allowed (combine them)")
00162       if $self->{factors}{0} && $self->context->flag("singleFactors");
00163     $self->{factors}{0} = 1; # mark as constant multiple;
00164     $self->{isPoly} = 3;  # factor over a number
00165   } else {
00166     $self->{isPoly} = $l->{isPoly};
00167     $self->{powers} = $l->{powers}; delete $l->{powers};
00168     $self->{exponents} = $l->{exponents}; delete $l->{exponents};
00169   }
00170   return 1;
00171 }
00172 
00173 ##############################################
00174 
00175 package PolynomialFactors::BOP::power;
00176 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPolynomial::BOP::power);
00177 
00178 sub checkPolynomial {
00179   my $self = shift; my ($l,$r) = ($self->{lop},$self->{rop});
00180   $self->Error("Exponents must be constant in a polynomial")
00181     unless LimitedPolynomial::isConstant($r);
00182   my $n = Parser::Evaluate($r);
00183   $r->Error($$Value::context->{error}{message}) if $$Value::context->{error}{flag};
00184   $n = $n->value;
00185   $self->Error("Exponents must be positive integers in a polynomial")
00186     unless $n > 0 && $n == int($n);
00187   if ($l->{isPoly}) {
00188     $self->Error("You can only raise a single term or factor to a power")
00189       if $l->{isPoly} > 2 && $self->context->flag("strictPowers");
00190     PolynomialFactors::markOpFactor($self,$l);
00191     $self->{isPoly} = 5; # factor to a power
00192   } else {
00193     LimitedPolynomial::markPowers($l);
00194     $self->{exponents} = $l->{exponents}; delete $l->{exponents};
00195     foreach my $i (@{$self->{exponents}}) {$i = $n if $i}
00196     $self->{isPower} = 1;
00197   }
00198   return 1;
00199 }
00200 
00201 sub checkStrict {
00202   my $self = shift;
00203   $self->Error("You can only use powers of a variable or factor");
00204 }

00208 package PolynomialFactors::UOP::minus;
00209 our @ISA = qw(LimitedPolynomial::UOP::minus);
00210 
00211 sub checkPolynomial {
00212   my $self = shift; my $op = $self->{op};
00213   if ($op->{isPoly} && $self->context->flag("singleFactors")) {
00214     $self->Error("Double negatives are not allowed") if $op->{isPoly} == 2;
00215     $self->Error("Only one factor or constant can be negated") if $op->{isPoly} == 4;
00216   }
00217   PolynomialFactors::markOpFactor($self,$op);
00218   $self->{factors}{0} = 1; # mark as constant multiple
00219   return 1;
00220 }
00221 
00222 ##############################################
00223 
00224 package PolynomialFactors;
00225 our @ISA = ('LimitedPolynomal');
00226 
00227 sub markFactor {
00228   my $self = shift;
00229   return if $self->{factors};
00230   $self->{factors} = {};
00231   if ($self->class eq 'Variable') {
00232     $self->{factors}{$self->{name}} = 1;
00233   } elsif ($self->class eq 'Number') {
00234     $self->{factors}{0} = 1;
00235   } elsif ($self->{isPoly} && $self->{isPoly} == 1) {
00236     $self->{factors}{$self->string} = 1;
00237   } elsif ($self->{isPower}) {
00238     $self->{factors}{$self->{lop}->string} = 1;
00239   }
00240 }
00241 
00242 sub markOpFactor {
00243   my $self = shift; my $op = shift;
00244   markFactor($op);
00245   $self->{factors} = $op->{factors};
00246   delete $op->{factors};
00247 }
00248 
00249 sub Init {
00250   #
00251   #  Build the new context that calls the
00252   #  above classes rather than the usual ones
00253   #
00254 
00255   my $context = $main::context{PolynomialFactors} = Parser::Context->getCopy("LimitedPolynomial");
00256   $context->{name} = "PolynomialFactors";
00257   $context->operators->set(
00258      '+' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::add'},
00259      '-' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::subtract'},
00260      '*' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::multiply'},
00261     '* ' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::multiply'},
00262     ' *' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::multiply'},
00263      ' ' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::multiply'},
00264      '/' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::divide'},
00265     ' /' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::divide'},
00266     '/ ' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::divide'},
00267      '^' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::power'},
00268     '**' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::BOP::power'},
00269     'u-' => {class => 'PolynomialFactors::UOP::minus'},
00270   );
00271   $context->flags->set(strictPowers => 1);
00272 
00273   #
00274   #  A context where coefficients can't include operations
00275   #
00276   $context = $main::context{"PolynomialFactors-Strict"} = $context->copy;
00277   $context->flags->set(
00278     strictCoefficients => 1, strictDivision => 1,
00279     singlePowers => 1, singleFactors => 1,
00280     reduceConstants => 0,
00281   );
00282   $context->functions->disable("All");  # can be re-enabled if needed
00283 
00284   main::Context("PolynomialFactors");  ### FIXME:  probably should require author to set this explicitly
00285 }
00286 
00287 1;
